articles.title: OpenAI CEO declares ‚Äúcode red‚Äù as Gemini gains 200 million users in 3 months
articles.description: Three years after Google sounded alarm bells over ChatGPT, the tables have turned.
articles.content: The shoe is most certainly on the other foot. On Monday, OpenAI CEO Sam Altman reportedly declared a ‚Äúcode red‚Äù at the company to improve ChatGPT, delaying advertising plans and other products in the process, The Information reported based on a leaked internal memo. The move follows Google‚Äôs release of its Gemini 3 model last month, which has outperformed ChatGPT on some industry benchmark tests and sparked high-profile praise on social media. In the memo, Altman wrote, ‚ÄúWe are at a critical tim

articles.content: You can tell a lot about a company by what they're willing to sue over. Take Instacart, which just filed a lawsuit against New York City. Its beef? The company doesn't like five new city laws, set to take effect in January. They would require Instacart to pay workers more and give customers a tipping option of at least 10 percent. Reuters reports that Instacart's suit targets Local Law 124, which mandates that grocery delivery workers receive the same minimum pay as restaurant delive

articles.content: Have you ever wondered what the little padlock üîí next to a website‚Äôs address actually means? Or why some URLs start with https:// instead of http:// ? But here‚Äôs the catch: it‚Äôs like sending a postcard through the mail. Anyone handling that postcard‚Äîyour internet provider, a hacker on the same Wi-Fi, or even someone snooping on network traffi

articles.title: Explicit is Better Than Implicit: Mastering Pytest Fixtures and Async Testing
articles.description: Look, we need to talk about async testing in Python. If you've ever stared at a ModuleNotFoundError: No module named 'trio' when you're just trying to test your FastAPI endpoints, you know the pain. You didn't ask for trio. You don't even know what trio is. You just want your tests to pass. Let's fi
articles.content: Look, we need to talk about async testing in Python. If you've ever stared at a ModuleNotFoundError: No module named 'trio' when you're just trying to test your FastAPI endpoints, you know the pain. You didn't ask for trio. You don't even know what trio is. You just want your tests to pass. Let's fix this properly. The Problem: Event Loops Are Confusing Here's the thing about async Python: your async / await code needs an event loop to run. That's not optional. And there are multiple event loop
articles.author: Chandrashekhar Kachawa

articles.title: How to orchestrate agents using mission control
articles.description: Run multiple Copilot agents from one place. Learn prompt techniques, how to spot drift early, and how to review agent work efficiently. The post How to orchestrate agents using mission control appeared first on The GitHub Blog .
articles.content: We recently shipped Agent HQ’s mission control , a unified interface for managing GitHub Copilot coding agent tasks. Now, you can now assign tasks to Copilot across repos, pick a custom agent, watch real‑time session logs, steer mid-run (pause, refine, or restart), and jump straight into the resulting pull requests—all in one place. Instead of bouncing between pages to see status, rationale, and changes, mission control centralizes assignment, oversight, and review. Having the
articles.author: Matt Nigh

articles.content: ExpressVPN, one of the best VPNs , is launching two brand-new features that sound confusingly like things it already does. Users on Android, Mac and iOS (but apparently not Windows, Linux or smart TVs) can now use Fastest Location to automatically pick the VPN server with the fastest download speed and lowest latency. Mac users are also getting an overhauled ExpressVPN app designed to work natively with MacOS. If you've used ExpressVPN before, your first reaction probably went something like

articles.content: Franck Nijhof—better known as Frenck—is one of those maintainers who ended up at the center of a massive open source project not because he chased the spotlight, but because he helped hold together one of the most active, culturally important, and technically demanding open source ecosystems on the planet. articles.content: Welcome back to The State of AI, a new collaboration between the Financial Times and MIT Technology Review . articles.description: The last Trump official in the position left amid allegations of petty revenge.
articles.content: The top drug regulator at the Food and Drug Administration, Richard Pazdur, has decided to retire from the agency just three weeks after taking the leading position, according to multiple media outlets. Pazdur, an oncologist who has worked at the FDA since 1999, was seen as a stabilizing force for an agency that has been mired in turmoil during the second Trump administration. articles.content: One of the iPhone‚Äôs many accessibility features is something Apple calls "Magnifier," which uses the smartphone's cameras to magnify and identify objects in the world around you.
